title.native: 泣きたい私は猫をかぶる
title.romaji: Nakitai Watashi wa Neko wo Kaburu

description:
Miyo Sasaki is an energetic high school girl who comes from a broken family consisting of her unconfident father and an overly invested stepmother, whose attempts at connecting with Miyo come across as bothersome. Seeing Kento Hinode as a refuge from all her personal issues, she can't help herself from forcing her unorthodox demonstrations of love onto her crush.

While Miyo is unable to get Kento's attention as herself, she manages to succeed by interacting with him in the form of a white cat, affectionately nicknamed ""Tarou"" by Kento. But Miyo soon realizes that she can't help Kento with the various problems she overhears in her cat form and is now caught between two tough choices. Will she continue her relationship with him as a cat, or will she reveal her identity and risk what they have, in order to help him as her human self?

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

Note: The film was slated to open in theaters in Japan on June 5, but was postponed due to COVID-19 and received an exclusive streaming on Netflix beginning on June 18.
synonyms: Loin de moi, près de toi

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Feet
tags.description: Features the sexual depiction or stimulation of a character's feet.

title.native: 泣きたい私は猫をかぶる

node.description: Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomotaka_shiba)

At the start of his career he worked at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) as a digital painter and only switched to animating after leaving the company. He has taken part in numerous of [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/)' productions since the release of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/). Currently he working as a director at [Studio Colorido](https://anilist.co/studio/4419/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satojumichi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤順一)

Junichi Satou is a Japanese anime director, best known for working on shoujo-based anime and in the magical girl genre. He was formerly associated with [TYO Animations](https://anilist.co/studio/333/), formerly known as [Hal Film Maker](https://anilist.co/studio/34/).

Satou’s first major work was directing the first, and a portion of the second season of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/), after which he handed the position over to [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/), although he continued to storyboard and direct episodes for the later seasons. Satou later went on to co-direct [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) alongside [Takuya Igarashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105087/), as well as the critically acclaimed [Princess Tutu](https://anilist.co/anime/721/). Satou served as chief director for long-runner [Sgt. Frog](https://anilist.co/anime/516/), and in recent years has become more known for his iyashikei works such as [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/) and [Tamayura](https://anilist.co/anime/9055/).

He's married to [Yasuno Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/144094/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

__[Website](http://yorushika.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nbuna_staff)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yorushika_official_/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4UK2Lzi6fBfUi9rpDt6cik)__

__Introduction:__
Yorushika is a Japanese rock duo under record label Universal Music Japan (2019-), having previously been under record label U&R Records (2017-2019). The group consists of N-buna (stylized as n-buna), a former vocaloid music producer and Suis, a female vocalist. The duo as of now is very secretive about their identity, and has never revealed their faces nor held many concerts. As a band they have only ever held two concerts, one in July, 2017 and another one in August, 2019.

The band's music is described as "passionate", "positive" and "upbeat", which serves as a signifcant contrast to the heavier lyrics. The lyrics often explore ideas such as love and human emotion and take inspiration from works of literature by Masuji Ibuse and Jules Verne. The group's name "Yorushika" is taken from the lyrics in their song "Kumo to Yuurei": "Yoru shika mou nemurezu ni" (meaning "I can only sleep at night"). Their eye-designed logo mark is a motif of two moons facing each other, which also serves as a clock hand, portraying the time "from 6:00 to night".

__Biography:__
Prior to the formation of the band Yorushika, N-buna already had a rather large following on the site Nico Nico Douga, a Japanese video hosting site, where he would first start releasing vocaloid music back in 2012. A year later in 2013, he would release a song titled "Toumei Elegy", which would peak on the platform's daily vocaloid rankings. Additionally, N-buna has produced two albums through U&R Records, a subsidiary of Nico Nico Douga's owner DWANGO Co., Ltd.

According to an interview with Japanese entertainment news website Natalie, N-buna and Suis met through a common acquantance, and at the time Suis was a longtime fan of N-buna's vocaloid work. Suis then later first appeared as a guest vocalist during N-buna's two solo concerts in Tokyo. After this N-buna reached out to Suis to form Yorushika as part of N-buna's effort to find a "more human" voice to use in his music, as opposed to the usual vocaloid. Since then, the two have released two EPs and three full albums, all of which have charted on both the Oricon Albums Chart and the Billboard Japan Hot 100 Albums Chart with their latest album "Plagiarism" reaching number one on the latter. Yorushika's popularity grew explosively through these rankings, with critics noting that the lyrics seemed to strike a chord with the younger audiences.

In 2020 Yorushika were nominated for the MTV Europe Music Awards in the category "Best Japanese Act".
They also won the "Top 5 new Artists" award at the 34th Japan Golden Disc Award.

Their faces and detailed personal profiles have not yet been disclosed to the public as they want their audiences to listen to their music without "preconceptions".

__Members:__
- [n-buna](https://anilist.co/staff/159212/nbuna) (ナブナ) – guitarist and in-charge of lyrics, composition and arrangement
- [Suis](https://anilist.co/staff/241696) (スイ) – vocalist

__Support Members:__
- Mitsuyasu Shimozuru (下鶴光康) – guitarist
- [Tatsuya Kitani](https://anilist.co/staff/161639/Tatsuya-Kitani) (キタニタツヤ) – bassist
- Masack (マサック) – drummer
- Tetsuya Hirahata (平畑徹也) – pianist

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

[Website](http://www.pyxie-llc.com/minakubota/) | [Blog](http://minakubota.blog8.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minakubota)

Mina is a composer and a pianist.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/151217/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3298914906)

Originating from [Imagin](https://anilist.co/studio/75/). Started off as a production manager.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [illustrator](https://anilist.co/staff/122887/)._

Graduated from Kyoto Seika University in 2012. Japanese animator, director and storyboard artist. Leader and founder of Studio Colorido's Team Yamahitsuji since fall 2018.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satojumichi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤順一)

Junichi Satou is a Japanese anime director, best known for working on shoujo-based anime and in the magical girl genre. He was formerly associated with [TYO Animations](https://anilist.co/studio/333/), formerly known as [Hal Film Maker](https://anilist.co/studio/34/).

Satou’s first major work was directing the first, and a portion of the second season of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/), after which he handed the position over to [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/), although he continued to storyboard and direct episodes for the later seasons. Satou served as chief director for long-runner [Sgt. He's married to [Yasuno Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/144094/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanashi742)

Cedric Herole is a Japan-based French animator who has worked on video games, anime and other forms of media. Herole worked with pH studio from 2005-2010 as a CGI animator for the pre-rendered cutscenes in Metroid: Other M. He also animated for the PlayStation 3 game Battle Princess of Arcadias. As of 2011, Cedric Herole works freelance.

**Robert Buchholz** is an American producer, voice actor, script/screenwriter, story editor, and voice director. He has produced voices for anime and video games. Robert is the owner of Spliced Bread Productions.
